column5: casting in da tree's
lol im not sure how I am suppose to take that.. either they were flying fish.. perched in trees.. or they were amongst the cover which happen to be lay down trees.  either way good stuff!
We were casting deep into the fallen trees along the shoreline....15' to 20' of water under the trees .   The trout would come up an ABSOLUTELY smash the Black Mepps ..
sawweeet ! makes me excited to go up north and fish for specks real soon
You guys pound'em every year there.  It's awesome.  Those fish are sweeeeet.
Wow, what a spectacular brookie report, and awesome photos! WTG
There is not much I can say that has not already been said....beauty!  Thanks for sharing
Dems some nice specks there...good job
STUNNING PICTURES...almost distracts from some pretty darned awesome fishing too...great report paul.
Thanks for all the comments Guys...
pictures are fantastic! good stuff!
those are some beautiful specs, awesome job  shorelines look exactly like our speckle lakes around here, we always get our biggest in the wood, lose alot of lures, but worth it
nicely done!!!!! great report and pics!!!

just a fantasy to me as a boy fishin the streams of N.B.. brookies like that were in short stories like tales of moby dick,not real, couldn't be real. great pic's of some awesome brook trout,,, and other wildlife.
Nice pics guys,keep the wildlife pics coming Paul You most certainly have a Knack for capturing lifes moments
I think the otter pic is the best....really nice shot!

Teamed up with 24/7 and hit a little Lake X up in the mountains in Gods Country..A little cool in the morning hours , but nothing the bright sun couldn't chase away in a hurry...water temp rocked back and forth between 53 and 54 degrees  And it wasn't long before they came out to play...24/7 working the fallen birch trees along the north side shoreline...three minutes on the lake = Bang !!            Clear water and Golden Specks...           Black Mepps was the ticket in the morning and Mini Big-o was the ticket in the afternoon      Later on in the afternoon all living creatures around seemed to be enjoying the sun.                       Only one speck was kept ..(  a bleeder )...All others released to swim another day..
Wow  Paul nice specks.Very nice pictures you took.
Great day and report.  I love the picture of the loon, and some nice fish too Congrats!
I'm jealous, hell I'm hugely jealous! In fact I was jealous of Jacques lone opening day Brookie, mayhaps that's why I haven't said nice Brookie Jacques.
Your in Gods counrty for sure. NNNiiiccceeee
Awesome pics WSB. Nice specks 24/7. The otter and loon pics are fantastic! Can't wait to see more speck reports from you guys.

the golden trout were blinding me .    thats how beautifull and lively it was.    sun wind temperture .  everything perfect.  was a long awaited week end.  and the fishing gods and mother nature paired up to give us the best they can offer.     GOD'S CONTRY
beautiful report and lovely wildlife and fish pics
Thanks for sharing...did this old soul some good!
Nice size on those specs, love the crystal clear water shot..
Gotta like it, man that clear water...
Good grief, nice to see all that wildlife! Great shots, beautiful fish guys!
Nicely done gentlemen, beautiful fish!!
Very very nice!!! Congrats to you on a great opener.
awesome trip guys whats that little guy on the log in the last picture
VERY nice, those specks are huge!
Amazing pics! Looks like you had a successful outing. I've never caught a spec on a crankbait, good job!
awsome, one day I have to make one of these back into the middle of nothing trips for those majestic fish... ( ohhhhh Solo!!!!  Im ready )

that crank is one of the best lure of the lake.  we found that out after most of the specks regurgatated minnows the same color and size.  they must eat 7-8 minnows every 1-2 houres.  they also love salamanders.  can you imagine the size of the lure you need to replicate that bug.  2-3 inches...  so they feed on big things.
A River Otter..
Big fish! I can't wait to fish Quebec in June!!! Thanks for the great report  TDunn
Nice specks! The wildlife pics are excellent too.
Everything about that report is wicked.
Great report and pics Paul How's the water level up there???  The other lake I fished on Friday, was supprised to see it so high even with the lack of precipitations.  Jacques
good job guys! how deep were the fish ?
